subtasks: Note the timing of the pruning (late March, early spring)
Gather necessary tools (pruners, lopper, Swedish saw)
Explain the purpose of opening up the canopy to reduce disease and improve airflow
Demonstrate cutting out high branches that grow vertically
Remove branches growing into the canopy to prevent rubbing and wounds
Highlight the importance of cutting near the branch collar to promote healing
Thin out interior branches for better circulation
Advise on the importance of gradual pruning not exceeding 25% annually
